intro: Streptocarpus beampingaratrensis subsp. antambolorum, commonly known as the Madagascar streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tubular or campanulate flowers in shades of pink or white. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. This subspecies is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
